Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETPosition-1 Description: If a geometry of iwxxm:geometry is defined with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:geometry/*[self::aixm:horizontalProjection or self::aixm:centreline]) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:geometry//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: tropicalCyclonePosition shall only be present in analysisCollection of TropicalCycloneSIGMET

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETPosition-2 Description: iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition shall only be present in iwxxm:analysisCollection of iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET Assertion: ( ( ( exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET) and (count(//iwxxm:analysisCollection) = count(//iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis//iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) ) ) and ( exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET) and not(exists(//iwxxm:supplementaryAnalysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis//iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) ) ) ) or ( not(exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET)) and (count(iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) = 0) ) )
Source -> Destination
The members of this collection

A SIGMET (significant meteorological) report. SIGMETs report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of specified en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena over time.
The SIGMET report class represents the base SIGMET types that may be reported such as squall lines, thunderstorms, dust storms, turbulence, etc. Tropical cyclone and volcanic ash SIGMET reports are subclasses of SIGMET due to their ability to report additional information, including volcano/tropical cyclone identification and forecast position(s).
SIGMETs may report either observed or forecast hazardous conditions. Additionally, a forecast position may be reported.

$XREFPROP=$XID={07DC4BCC-977F-4eb7-B703-7C1EB86E3824}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={1C3924B3-E438-4ab8-BF89-C5148CAFB866}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The time at which this report was issued
Not Specified

The ATS unit serving the FIR or CTA to which the SIGMET refers
ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2: A6-1: "Location indicator of FIR/CTA"
Not Specified
MWO originating this report
Not Specified
The ATS region (FIR, UIR, CTA, or FIR/UIR)
Not Specified
The sequence number of this message. For example: "5", "A3", or "2"
Not Specified

The valid period for the entire report covering all observations and forecast conditions. Each observation/forecast phenomenon includes its own temporal description for the described meteorological conditions, which is represented as phenomenonTime.
For example, an issued tropical cyclone SIGMET may be valid from 1600 UTC to 2200 UTC with an observed position at 1600 UTC and a forecast position of the centre of the tropical cyclone at 2200 UTC. In this case the SIGMET validPeriod would be 1600 UTC to 2200 UTC, the analysis phenomenonTime would be 1600 UTC, and the forecastPositionAnalysis phenomenonTime would be 2200 UTC.
Not Specified

The sequence number of a previous SIGMET that is cancelled by this SIGMET. Mandatory when this is a cancellation report, must be missing otherwise
Examples: YUDD SIGMET 2 VALID ... YUDD SIGMET A3 VALID ...
Not Specified
The valid period of a previous SIGMET that is cancelled by this SIGMET. Mandatory when this is a cancellation report, must be missing otherwise
Not Specified

The reported phenomenon, such as thunderstorm, tropical cyclone, icing, mountain wave, etc.
The expected end of occurrence of volcanic ash ("NO VA EXP") is indicated with a missing SIGMET phenomenon with a nil reason of nothingOfOperationalSignificance
Not Specified
Observed and/or forecast conditions of the phenomenon.
Not Specified
Indicates whether the report is a 'CANCELLATION' report (true) which cancels a previously issued report or not (false or empty).
Not Specified
Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-1 Description: A SIGMET report cannot have a reportStatus of 'AMENDMENT' or 'CORRECTION' Assertion: ( @reportStatus != 'AMENDMENT' and @reportStatus != 'CORRECTION' )

Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-12 Description: If a geometry is defined for iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: forecastPositionAnalysis and directionOfMotion (with or without speedOfMotion) are mutually exclusive

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-7 Description: A report cannot have both iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis and iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:directionOfMotion (with or without iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:speedOfMotion) at the same time Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( (exists(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis) and empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:directionOfMotion) and empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:speedOfMotion)) or (empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis) and exists(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:directionOfMotion)) or (empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:forecastPositionAnalysis) and empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:directionOfMotion) and empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:speedOfMotion)) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a CANCELLATION report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-3 Description: A 'CANCELLATION' report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit, iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion, iwxxm:sequenceNumber, iwxxm:validPeriod, iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber, iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod. Elements iwxxm:phenomenon and iwxxm:analysisCollection shall be absent Assertion: ( if( (@isCancelReport = 'true') and (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion) and exists(iwxxm:sequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) and exists(iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod) and empty(iwxxm:phenomenon) and empty(iwxxm:analysisCollection) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a non-operational report and a report that failed translation

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-2 Description: A non-operational report or a report that failed translation should have as a minimum appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit and iwxxm:validPeriod Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) gt 0) or (@permissibleUsage = 'NON-OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in an ordinary report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMET-4 Description: An ordinary report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit, iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion, iwxxm:sequenceNumber, iwxxm:validPeriod, iwxxm:phenomenon and iwxxm:analysisCollection. Elements iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber and iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod shall be absent Assertion: ( if( (empty(@isCancelReport) or @isCancelReport = 'false') and (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion) and exists(iwxxm:sequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) and empty(iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber) and empty(iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod) and exists(iwxxm:phenomenon) and exists(iwxxm:analysisCollection) ) else( true() ) )
Source -> Destination
Source -> Destination
Source -> Destination
Weather phenomenon of significance to aviation operations; used in SIGMET and AIRMET reports. The set of permitted options are defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2 C.3.1 sub-clause 1.1.4

$XREFPROP=$XID={1C84E5C3-C0C7-4d1d-9461-870AD9A91757}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=codeList;GUID={98671F90-3766-483f-AF10-CCAEFF4AC31E};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::codeList;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={1DC0159C-2B6C-49ed-AF82-AD5E29FFACAA}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

Conditions that indicate the presence of a specific SIGMET phenomenon such as volcanic ash or a thunderstorm, along with expected changes to the phenomenon such as intensity, speed, and direction. These conditions are reported with OBS/FCST conditions on all SIGMET types.
TC TOP (ABV and BLW) conditions are represented by the vertical component of the geometry. For example: CB TOP FL500 is represented as a missing lowerLimit and an upperLimit of 500FL.
In cases where the position covers an entire FIR or CTA, ("ENTIRE CTA or ENTIRE FIR" from ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2), the geometry should be an xlink to the AirspaceVolume under geometryComponent of issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion.

$XREFPROP=$XID={AD75D834-C781-4386-9F9D-8E0BA784D46F}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={3D366995-2CBD-4698-B11D-C352C791F6DF}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The position of a tropical cyclone. Only be used in a TropicalCycloneSIGMET.
Not Specified

The expected geographic region(s) affected by the reported phenomenon at a particular time (thunderstorms, volcanic ash, etc.). This geometry covers all combinations of phenomenon historically reported in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2: a boundary with a base and top, a TC centre position, and a VA line with a width
Not Specified

This element refers to the expected direction of movement which the phenomenon is moving towards, .e.g, "moving east". Stationary phenomenon shall be denoted with both iwxxm:directionOfMotion and iwxxm:speedOfMotion absent.
This element value is given in degrees from true North. Plane angle unit of measure (uom) is "deg".
Not Specified

The expected speed of movement of a meteorological condition. Stationary phenomenon shall be denoted with both iwxxm:directionOfMotion and iwxxm:speedOfMotion absent.
speedOfMotion can be provided in either two units of measures: "km/h" or "[kn_i]" (knots).
Not Specified

The expected change in intensity for the reported meteorological condition (e.g., intensifying, weakening, or no change) determined at the time of SIGMET analysis based on the current state of the meteorological condition
Not Specified
Indicator of whether the location of phenomena is approximate. If not reported locations are not approximate
Not Specified

Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETEvolvingCondition-4 Description: If a geometry of iwxxm:geometry is defined with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:geometry//*[self::aixm:horizontalProjection or self::aixm:centreline]) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:geometry//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETEvolvingCondition-2 Description: directionOfMotion shall be reported in degrees (deg) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:directionOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then ( iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@uom = 'deg' ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETEvolvingCondition-1 Description: iwxxm:speedOfMotion cannot be given without having iwxxm:directionOfMotion Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:speedOfMotion) ) then( exists(iwxxm:directionOfMotion) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETEvolvingCondition-3 Description: speedOfMotion shall be reported in kilometres per hour (km/h) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:speedOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then ( (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = 'km/h') or (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: tropicalCyclonePosition shall only be present in analysisCollection of TropicalCycloneSIGMET

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: SIGMET.SIGMETEvolvingCondition-5 Description: iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition shall only be present in iwxxm:analysisCollection of iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET Assertion: ( ( ( exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET) and (count(//iwxxm:analysisCollection) = count(//iwxxm:analysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) ) ) and ( exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET) and not(exists(//iwxxm:supplementaryAnalysisCollection//iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) ) ) ) or ( not(exists(/iwxxm:TropicalCycloneSIGMET)) and (count(iwxxm:tropicalCyclonePosition) = 0) ) )
Source -> Destination
The members of this collection
A collection of SIGMETEvolvingConditions, each representing a location where SIGMET observed or forecast conditions exist. All members of this collection are of type SIGMETEvolvingCondition.

$XREFPROP=$XID={A0D34A3D-5152-4b86-97BB-36055FF14B7B}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={3DEC1658-10E0-48ae-A866-993BA84325B0}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The time at which meteorological phenomena occur
Not Specified
Indication whether the information is observed and expected to continue, or forecast
Not Specified
A SIGMET that reports the presence of a tropical cyclone conditions. This extends the base SIGMET type by including additional information necessary for tropical cyclones.

$XREFPROP=$XID={7BF5795C-E59C-4d62-AEC6-2B65B159C33E}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={4D7FA6A5-1F7F-4f27-B71F-DDC418C64A1B}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
Observed and/or forecast conditions of the cumulonimbus clouds associated with a tropical cyclone. To be used for more than one cumulonimbus clouds simultaneously affecting the FIR concerned.
Not Specified
The tropical cyclone being reported in this SIGMET, required in all cases other than cancellations. When reporting the tropical cyclone name, 'NN' may be used if the tropical cyclone is unnamed
Not Specified

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a CANCELLATION report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: TropicalCycloneSIGMET.TropicalCycloneSIGMET-1 Description: In a 'CANCELLATION' report iwxxm:TropicalCyclone shall be absent Assertion: ( if( @isCancelReport = 'true' and string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0 ) then( empty(iwxxm:tropicalCyclone) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in an ordinary report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: TropicalCycloneSIGMET.TropicalCycloneSIGMET-2 Description: An ordinary report should also have iwxxm:TropicalCyclone Assertion: ( if( (empty(@isCancelReport) or @isCancelReport = 'false') and string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0 ) then( exists(iwxxm:tropicalCyclone) ) else( true() ) )
Conditions observed and/or forecast of the SIGMET phenomenon.

$XREFPROP=$XID={D7D36AC3-247E-4ab1-B6FB-48FB30D258DA}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={4FE5BCDF-70F6-4858-B6C7-B00299AFEC81}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

A SIGMET report may include, at a time instant, a phenomenon covering more than one area within the FIR/UIR/CTA. This translates into observed or forecast conditions at the time instant for each of these reported areas. All combinations of observations or forecasts of meteorological conditions, including changing conditions, are represented by their own SIGMETEvolvingCondition.
Each analysis has a single SIGMETEvolvingConditionCollection as its result.
Not Specified

A forecast of the phenomenon at a time instant within the valid period. This is modeled by SIGMETPosition for individual area of the phenomenon and aggregated into a single SIGMETPositionCollection as a result to forecastPositionAnalysis.
Not Specified
A SIGMET that reports the presence of volcanic ash conditions hazardous to flight. This extends the base SIGMET type by including additional information necessary for volcanoes and volcanic ash.

$XREFPROP=$XID={46FBA324-5F2D-4576-9F1A-35556648B487}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={5C9F8ECF-A127-4416-B20F-6AD38E609469}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The volcano that is erupting - required in all cases other than cancellations
Not Specified
The FIR to which volcanic ash has moved. Reported only on SIGMET cancellation reports
Not Specified

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshSIGMET.VolcanicAshSIGMET-6 Description: If a geometry is defined for iwxxm:eruptingVolcano//metce:position by providing @srsName, @srsDimension must equal to 2 and @aixsLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:eruptingVolcano//metce:position) ) then( empty(for $i in iwxxm:eruptingVolcano//metce:position//gml:pos/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()] return $i[not(@srsDimension='2') or @axisLabels='']) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshSIGMET.VolcanicAshSIGMET-7 Description: If a geometry is defined for iwxxm:volcanicAshMovedToFIR//aixm:geometryComponent by providing @srsName, @srsDimension must equal to 2 and @aixsLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:volcanicAshMovedToFIR//aixm:geometryComponent) ) then( iwxxm:volcanicAshMovedToFIR//aixm:geometryComponent//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a CANCELLATION report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: VolcanicAshSIGMET.VolcanicAshSIGMET-1 Description: In a 'CANCELLATION' report iwxxm:eruptingVolcano shall be absent Assertion: ( if( @isCancelReport = 'true' and string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0 ) then( empty(iwxxm:eruptingVolcano) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: volcanicAshMovedToFIR can only be used in a 'CANCELLATION' report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: VolcanicAshSIGMET.VolcanicAshSIGMET-3 Description: iwxxm:volcanicAshMovedToFIR can only be used in a 'CANCELLATION' report Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:volcanicAshMovedToFIR) ) then( @isCancelReport = 'true' ) else( true() ) )
A collection of SIGMETPositions, each representing a location where meteorological conditions exist. All members of this collection are of type SIGMETPosition.

$XREFPROP=$XID={ECB25B09-EC5E-4df7-A637-7D8083D11BEE}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={7BDD4534-E84E-4cf5-9E16-5F576433E397}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The time at which meteorological phenomena occur
Not Specified

Examples of significant weather phenomena: - Obscured thunderstorm (OBSC_TS) - Obscured thunderstorm with hail (OBSC_TSGR) - Embedded thunderstorm (EMBD_TS) - Embedded thunderstorm with hail (EMBD_TSGR) - Frequent thunderstorm (FRQ_TS) - Frequent thunderstorm with hail (FRQ_TSGR) - Squall line (SQL_TS) - Squall line with hail (SQL_TSGR) - Tropical cyclone (TC) - Severe turbulence (SEV_TURB) - Severe airframe icing (SEV_ICE) - Severe airframe icing from freezing rain (SEV_ICE_FZRA) - Severe mountain wave (SEV_MTW) - Heavy dust storm (HVY_DS) - Heavy sand storm (HVY_SS) - Volcanic ash (VA) - Radioactive cloud (RDOACT_CLD)

AIRMET reporting constructs as defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2.
AIRMETs report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of specified en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena in time and space. These weather phenomena are reported as impacted regions of airspace.
References to WMO and ICAO Technical Regulations within this XML schema shall have no formal status and are for information purposes only. Where there are differences between the Technical Regulations and the schema, the Technical Regulations shall take precedence. Technical Regulations may impose requirements that are not described in this schema.
Used for OBS and FCST conditions on all AIRMET reports

A weather condition reducing visibility, such as dust, rain or volcanic ash.
See ICAO Annex 3/ WMO No. 49-2 Appendix 6 Section 2.1.

$XREFPROP=$XID={EB45B775-01CD-4596-ACAA-D36DEC22FA17}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=codeList;GUID={98671F90-3766-483f-AF10-CCAEFF4AC31E};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::codeList;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={139F1296-224A-4433-87CA-901850CF2256}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
A collection of AIRMETEvolvingConditions, each representing a location where AIRMET observed or forecast conditions exist. All members of this collection are of type AIRMETEvolvingCondition.

$XREFPROP=$XID={2BDE122C-F573-4489-9669-D02AE8B698AB}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={783A5ADA-986D-440b-A671-1370EC0C978E}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

Not Specified

Not Specified
Source -> Destination
The members of this collection.

Examples: - Mist (BR) - Duststorm (DS) - Dust (DU) - Drizzle (DZ) - Funnel Cloud (FC) - Fog (FG) - Smoke (FU) - Hail (GR) - Small hail (GS) - Haze (HZ) - Ice pellets (PL) - Dust/stand whirls (PO) - Rain (RA) - Sand (SA) - Snow grams (SG) - Snow (SN) - Squall (SQ) - Sandstorm (SS) - Volcanic Ash (VA)

Expected change in intensity for AIRMET phenomena.
See WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 Part B FM 94 BUFR code-table 0 20 028 'Expected change in intensity'.

$XREFPROP=$XID={1BAA842D-8BBA-422c-9BEF-2785DBE8686F}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=enumeration;GUID={AD881009-405F-4e8d-9E28-D17F8D05992D};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::enumeration;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={899438FC-DFE6-411f-AFCF-78D51F51652A}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={D2C578DF-6FD2-4163-8B16-48FE7EDB55FE}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=enum;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={D735041B-03FC-46e2-9F1A-8478F9DDF3D8}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
Forecast to weaken (WKN)
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={81A60861-A0D3-4c4b-82F6-F623FC141119}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=enum;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={CA5E5E93-E46C-48a7-9BB9-3C75291DF42B}$CLT;$ENDXREF;

Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={DDD2AC7A-5278-451f-B537-A74947B9C98D}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=enum;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={7347A911-1EFA-4af7-86EF-95E0DA79F295}$CLT;$ENDXREF;

Conditions that indicate the presence of a specific AIRMET phenomenon such as mountain obscuration or a thunderstorm, along with expected changes to the phenomenon such as intensity, speed, and direction. These conditions are reported with OBS/FCST conditions on all AIRMET types.
TC TOP (ABV and BLW) conditions are represented by the vertical component of the geometry. For example: CB TOP FL500 is represented as a missing lowerLimit and an upperLimit of 500FL.

$XREFPROP=$XID={F7D7D8EF-3A62-4749-81F5-D451976F0DF0}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={98C5C15D-3D04-47d6-B1C2-14B7ABFF9F9B}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

The expected geographic region(s) affected by the reported phenomenon at a particular time (thunderstorms, volcanic ash, etc.). This geometry covers all combinations of phenomenon historically reported in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2: a boundary with a base and top, a TC centre position, and a VA line with a width
Not Specified

The expected direction of movement of a meteorological condition. Stationary phenomenon shall be denoted with both iwxxm:directionOfMotion and iwxxm:speedOfMotion absent. Direction of motion to shall be given in degrees from true North. Plane angle unit of measure (uom) is "deg".
Not Specified

The expected speed of movement of a meteorological condition. Stationary phenomenon shall be denoted with both iwxxm:directionOfMotion and iwxxm:speedOfMotion absent. Speed of movement shall be given in either "km/h" or "[kn_i]" (knot).
Not Specified

The expected change in intensity for the reported meteorological condition (e.g., intensifying, weakening, or no change) determined at the time of AIRMET analysis based on the current state of the meteorological condition
Not Specified

The cloud base of reported clouds. Only used with an AIRMET reporting cloud phenomenon. Height of cloud base shall be given in either "m" (metres) or "[ft_i]" (feet).
Cloud base and top may differ from but should be within the AIRMET base and top which are reported in airspace upper and lower limits.
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={AC72B0F6-3F76-4f28-8447-F64829838508}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={99134892-EC0E-473c-B6CE-0983B7A4DA4F}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
The reference surface used for the value of the cloud base. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={F85E0507-A78F-4f2c-8892-79A81B40D0B2}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={B8985C48-587B-4f86-83B0-4244E2FFAB82}$CLT;$ENDXREF;

The cloud top of reported clouds. Only used with an AIRMET reporting cloud phenomenon. Height of cloud top shall be given in either "m" (metres) or "[ft_i]" (feet).
Cloud base and top may differ from but should be within the AIRMET base and top which are reported in airspace upper and lower limits.
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={A7AE7830-15B7-46d3-8CB3-E6AC3D349815}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={2DE1826E-4B85-414a-A044-9AAC69CF9E69}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
The reference surface used for the value of the cloud base. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={BCD12293-149D-458f-8AC6-11F9C396C346}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={97AA48BA-28BE-4acc-9EA6-D48F8C1E80D7}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
Indicates whether the cloud top is above the reported values.
Not Specified

The surface visibility. Only used with SFC VIS AIRMETs. Horizontal surface visibility unit of measure shall be given as "m" (metre).
ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2: Appendix 6 Section 2.1
Not Specified
The weather condition(s) causing reduced visibility.
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={B1401A07-9388-413a-A974-A5E896F79FE3}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={E5D9A229-F1B2-4dc7-BE64-1C35D48EC83C}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
The widespread surface wind direction. Only used with SFC WIND AIRMETs. Unit of measure shall be given as "deg" in degrees from true North. A true north wind is indicated with a direction of 360.
Not Specified
The widespread surface wind speed. Only used with SFC WIND AIRMETs. Surface wind speed unit of measure shall be given as "m/s" or "[kn_i]" (knot).
Not Specified
Indicator of whether the location of phenomena is approximate. If not reported locations are not approximate
Not Specified

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-1 Description: cloudBase shall be reported in metres (m) or feet ([ft_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:cloudBase) and not(iwxxm:cloudBase/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:cloudBase/@uom = 'm') or (iwxxm:cloudBase/@uom = '[ft_i]') ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-2 Description: cloudTop shall be reported in metres (m) or feet ([ft_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:cloudTop) and not(iwxxm:cloudTop/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:cloudTop/@uom = 'm') or (iwxxm:cloudTop/@uom = '[ft_i]') ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-9 Description: If a geometry of iwxxm:geometry is defined with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:geometry//*[self::aixm:horizontalProjection or self::aixm:centreline]) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:geometry//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-3 Description: directionOfMotion shall be reported in degrees (deg) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:directionOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@uom = 'deg' ) else true())

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-4 Description: speedOfMotion shall be reported in kilometres per hour (km/h) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:speedOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = 'km/h') or (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-5 Description: surfaceVisibility shall be reported in metres (m) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:surfaceVisibility) and not(iwxxm:surfaceVisibility/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( iwxxm:surfaceVisibility/@uom = 'm' ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: surfaceWindDirection and surfaceWindSpeed must be reported together

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-8 Description: surfaceWindDirection and surfaceWindSpeed must be reported together Assertion: ( if( not((exists(iwxxm:surfaceWindDirection) and exists(iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed)) or (empty(iwxxm:surfaceWindDirection) and empty(iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed))) ) then( false() ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-7 Description: surfaceWindDirection shall be reported in the degrees unit of measure ('deg') Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:surfaceWindDirection) and not(iwxxm:surfaceWindDirection/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( iwxxm:surfaceWindDirection/@uom = 'deg' ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMETEvolvingCondition-6 Description: surfaceWindSpeed shall be reported in metres per second (m/s) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed) and not(iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed/@uom = 'm/s') or (iwxxm:surfaceWindSpeed/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )
Weather phenomenon of significance to aviation operations; used in AIRMET reports. The set of permitted options are defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2 C.3.1 sub-clause 1.1.4

$XREFPROP=$XID={649750ED-5E40-4ee8-95A1-BDB285915A60}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=codeList;GUID={98671F90-3766-483f-AF10-CCAEFF4AC31E};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::codeList;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={A532F662-677A-49ba-A0A7-E0097ACF1901}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

An AIRMET (significant meteorological) report. AIRMETs report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of specified en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena over time.
The AIRMET report class represents the base AIRMET types that may be reported such as squall lines, thunderstorms, dust storms, turbulence, etc. AIRMETs may report either observed or forecast hazardous conditions.

$XREFPROP=$XID={9A311BB8-6221-47f6-A13A-641AD4687D65}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=featureType;GUID={CE991AF3-0AA8-4985-88A3-A38573F5C509};FQName=UML Profile for METCE data specifications::featureType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={CEE56B35-64F8-4ea1-AD72-1F42BC3D76A6}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;
The time at which this report was issued
Not Specified
The ATS unit serving the FIR or CTA to which the AIRMET refers. ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2: A6-1: "Location indicator of FIR/CTA"
Not Specified
MWO originating this report
Not Specified
The ATS region (FIR, UIR, CTA, or FIR/UIR)
Not Specified
The sequence number of this message. For example: "5", "A3", or "2"
Not Specified

The valid period for the entire report, including all observations and forecast conditions. Each observation/forecast phenomenon includes its own period of validity for described meteorological conditions, which is represented as the O&M Observation validTime.
Not Specified

The sequence number of a previous AIRMET that is cancelled by this AIRMET. Mandatory when this is a cancellation report, must be missing otherwise
Examples: YUDD AIRMET 2 VALID ... YUDD AIRMET A3 VALID ...
Not Specified
The valid period of a previous AIRMET that is cancelled by this AIRMET. Mandatory when this is a cancellation report, must be missing otherwise
Not Specified
The reported phenomenon, such as thunderstorm, tropical cyclone, icing, mountain wave, etc.
Not Specified

AIRMETs may include the same phenomenon covering more than one area within the FIR/UIR/CTA, as well as observed and forecast conditions for each of these reported areas. AIRMETs may include a single set of observed and/or forecast conditions at a particular time, which is represented as a single analysis with a single AIRMETEvolvingConditionCollection as its result.
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={3A6D6D23-623C-4e95-90F0-F4073DBC448A}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={553B7940-5690-4d37-BE23-4E8863A74BF7}$CLT;$ENDXREF;
Indicates whether the report is a 'CANCELLATION' report (true) which cancels a previously issued report or not (false or empty).
Not Specified
Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-1 Description: An AIRMET report cannot have a reportStatus of 'AMENDMENT' or 'CORRECTION' Assertion: ( @reportStatus != 'AMENDMENT' and @reportStatus != 'CORRECTION' )

UML:Constraint.name: analysis//phenomenonTime of a forecast phenomenon must be greater than or equal to validPeriod//beginPosition

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-5b Description: iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:phenomenonTime of a forecast phenomenon must be greater than or equal to iwxxm:validPeriod//gml:beginPosition Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') and (iwxxm:analysis/iwxxm:*/@timeIndicator = 'FORECAST') and exists(iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:phenomenonTime/*) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod/*) ) then( empty(index-of(for $i in iwxxm:analysis return number(translate($i//iwxxm:phenomenonTime/gml:TimeInstant/gml:timePosition,'-T:Z','')) ge number(translate(iwxxm:validPeriod/gml:TimePeriod/gml:beginPosition,'-T:Z','')),false())) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: analysis//phenomenonTime of an observation phenomenon must be less than or equal to validPeriod//beginPosition

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-5a Description: iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:phenomenonTime of an observed phenomenon must be less than or equal to iwxxm:validPeriod//gml:beginPosition Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') and (iwxxm:analysis/iwxxm:*/@timeIndicator = 'OBSERVATION') and exists(iwxxm:analysis//iwxxm:phenomenonTime/*) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod/*) ) then( empty(index-of(for $i in iwxxm:analysis return number(translate($i//iwxxm:phenomenonTime/gml:TimeInstant/gml:timePosition,'-T:Z','')) le number(translate(iwxxm:validPeriod/gml:TimePeriod/gml:beginPosition,'-T:Z','')),false())) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-6 Description: If a geometry is defined for iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion//aixm:geometryComponent//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a CANCELLATION report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-3 Description: A 'CANCELLATION' report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit, iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion, iwxxm:sequenceNumber, iwxxm:validPeriod, iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber, iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod. Elements iwxxm:phenomenon and iwxxm:analysis shall be absent Assertion: ( if( (@isCancelReport= 'true') and (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion) and exists(iwxxm:sequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) and exists(iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod) and empty(iwxxm:phenomenon) and empty(iwxxm:analysis) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a non-operational report or a report that failed translation

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-2 Description: A non-operational report or a report that failed translation should have as a minimum appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit and iwxxm:validPeriod Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) gt 0) or (@permissibleUsage = 'NON-OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in an ordinary report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: AIRMET.AIRMET-4 Description: An ordinary report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit, iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice, iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion, iwxxm:sequenceNumber, iwxxm:validPeriod, iwxxm:phenomenon and iwxxm:analysis. Elements iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber and iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod shall be absent Assertion: ( if( (empty(@isCancelReport) or @isCancelReport = 'false') and (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesUnit) and exists(iwxxm:originatingMeteorologicalWatchOffice) and exists(iwxxm:issuingAirTrafficServicesRegion) and exists(iwxxm:sequenceNumber) and exists(iwxxm:validPeriod) and empty(iwxxm:cancelledReportSequenceNumber) and empty(iwxxm:cancelledReportValidPeriod) and exists(iwxxm:phenomenon) and exists(iwxxm:analysis) ) else( true() ) )
Source -> Destination

Examples of weather phenomena: - Widespread mean surface wind (SFC WSPD nn[n]MPS) - Surface visibility (SFC VIS nnnnM (mm)) - Isolated thunderstorms (ISOL TS) - Occasional thunderstorms (OCNL TS) - Isolated thunderstorms with hail (ISOL TSGR) - Occasional thunderstorms with hail (OCNL TSGR) - Mountain obscuration (MT OBSC) - Broken cloud (BKN CLD) - Overcast cloud (OVC CLD) - Isolated cumulonimbus cloud (ISOL CB) - Occasional cumulonimbus cloud (OCNL CB) - Frequent cumulonimbus cloud (FRQ CB) - Isolated towering cumulus cloud (ISOL TCU) - Occasional towering cumulus cloud (OCNL TCU) - Frequent towering cumulus cloud (FRQ TCU) - Moderate icing (MOD ICE) - Moderate turbulence (MOD TURB) - Moderate mountain wave (MOD MTW)

Tropical Cyclone Advisory reporting constructs as defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2.
Tropical Cyclone Advisories (TCA) report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of tropical cyclone phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena in time and space.
References to WMO and ICAO Technical Regulations within this XML schema shall have no formal status and are for information purposes only. Where there are differences between the Technical Regulations and the schema, the Technical Regulations shall take precedence. Technical Regulations may impose requirements that are not described in this schema.
Tropical Cyclone Advisory.xml
Enterprise Architect XMI/UML 1.3
Forecast conditions of a tropical cyclone
Tropical Cyclone Advisory

Pattern ID: TropicalCycloneAdvisory.TropicalCycloneForecastConditions-1 Description: maximumSurfaceWindSpeed shall be reported in metres per second (m/s) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:maximumSurfaceWindSpeed) and not(iwxxm:maximumSurfaceWindSpeed/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:maximumSurfaceWindSpeed/@uom = 'm/s') or (iwxxm:maximumSurfaceWindSpeed/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )

An advisory of tropical cyclone conditions of significance to aviation as represented in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2. Tropical cyclone advisories are issued by tropical cyclone advisory centres (TCACs)

Use attribute indeterminatePosition to element timePosition to indicate if the actual temporal position is before or after the specified value.

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a non-operational report or a report that failed translation

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: TropicalCycloneAdvisory.TropicalCycloneAdvisory-1 Description: A non-operational report or a report that failed translation should have as a minimum appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime and iwxxm:issuingTropicalCycloneAdvisoryCentre Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) gt 0) or (@permissibleUsage = 'NON-OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingTropicalCycloneAdvisoryCentre) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in an ordinary report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: TropicalCycloneAdvisory.TropicalCycloneAdvisory-2 Description: An ordinary report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingTropicalCycloneAdvisoryCentre, iwxxm:tropicalCycloneName, iwxxm:advisoryNumber, iwxxm:observation, iwxxm:forecast, iwxxm:remarks and iwxxm:nextAdvisoryTime Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingTropicalCycloneAdvisoryCentre) and exists(iwxxm:tropicalCycloneName) and exists(iwxxm:advisoryNumber) and exists(iwxxm:observation) and exists(iwxxm:forecast) and exists(iwxxm:remarks) and exists(iwxxm:nextAdvisoryTime) ) else( true() ) )

Volcanic Ash Advisory reporting constructs as defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2.
Volcanic Ash Advisories report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of specified en-route volcanic ash phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena in time and space. These phenomena are reported as impacted regions of airspace.
References to WMO and ICAO Technical Regulations within this XML schema shall have no formal status and are for information purposes only. Where there are differences between the Technical Regulations and the schema, the Technical Regulations shall take precedence. Technical Regulations may impose requirements that are not described in this schema.

The volcanic ash cloud forecast status indicates the condition other than providing a valid forecast of the volcanic ash cloud. These include:
NO_VA_EXP: No volcanic ash is expected NOT_AVBL: Forecast is not available NOT_PROVIDED: Forecast is not provided
Volcanic Ash Advisory

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshCloudObservedOrEstimated-3 Description: If a geometry of iwxxm:ashCloudExtent is defined with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:ashCloudExtent//*[self::aixm:horizontalProjection or self::aixm:centreline]) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:ashCloudExtent//*[self::aixm:Surface or self::aixm:Curve]/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshCloud-1 Description: directionOfMotion shall be reported in degrees (deg) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:directionOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( iwxxm:directionOfMotion/@uom = 'deg' ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshCloud-2 Description: speedOfMotion shall be reported in kilometres per hour (km/h) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:speedOfMotion) and not(iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = 'km/h') or (iwxxm:speedOfMotion/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshAdvisory-3 Description: If a geometry is defined for iwxxm:volcano//metce:position with the provision of attribute srsName, attribute srsDimension must equal to 2 and attribute axisLabels must be non-empty Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:volcano//metce:position) ) then( empty(index-of(iwxxm:volcano//metce:position//gml:pos/(ancestor-or-self::*[exists(@srsName)])[last()]/(@srsDimension='2' and exists(@axisLabels)), false())) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in a non-operational report or a report that failed translation

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshAdvisory-1 Description: A non-operational report or a report that failed translation should have as a minimum appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime and iwxxm:issuingVolcanicAshAdvisoryCentre Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) gt 0) or (@permissibleUsage = 'NON-OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingVolcanicAshAdvisoryCentre) ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Mandatory items in an ordinary report

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshAdvisory-2 Description: An ordinary report should have appropriately filled elements including iwxxm:issueTime, iwxxm:issuingVolcanicAshAdvisoryCentre, iwxxm:volcano, iwxxm:stateOrRegion, iwxxm:summitElevation, iwxxm:advisoryNumber, iwxxm:informationSource, iwxxm:eruptionDetails, iwxxm:observation, iwxxm:forecast, iwxxm:remarks and iwxxm:nextAdvisoryTime Assertion: ( if( (string-length(@translationFailedTAC) eq 0) and (@permissibleUsage = 'OPERATIONAL') ) then( exists(iwxxm:issueTime) and exists(iwxxm:issuingVolcanicAshAdvisoryCentre) and exists(iwxxm:volcano) and exists(iwxxm:stateOrRegion) and exists(iwxxm:summitElevation) and exists(iwxxm:advisoryNumber) and exists(iwxxm:informationSource) and exists(iwxxm:eruptionDetails) and exists(iwxxm:observation) and exists(iwxxm:forecast) and exists(iwxxm:remarks) and exists(iwxxm:nextAdvisoryTime) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: VolcanicAshAdvisory.VolcanicAshObservedOrEstimatedConditions-1 Description: When @status is equal to 'IDENTIFIABLE', iwxxm:ashCloud must exists and iwxxm:windConditions must be empty Assertion: ( if( @status = 'IDENTIFIABLE' ) then( (count(iwxxm:ashCloud) ge 1) and empty(iwxxm:windConditions) ) else( true() ) )

Space Weather Advisory reporting constructs as defined in ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2.
Space Weather Advisories report the occurrence and/or expected occurrence of space weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations, and of the development of those phenomena in time and space. These phenomena are reported as impacted regions of airspace.
References to WMO and ICAO Technical Regulations within this XML schema shall have no formal status and are for information purposes only. Where there are differences between the Technical Regulations and the schema, the Technical Regulations shall take precedence. Technical Regulations may impose requirements that are not described in this schema.
Space Weather Advisory

Space Weather Advisory

This package defines a collective and selected meteorological objects for the World Area Forecast System (WAFS) to deliver forecasts of significant en-route weather phenomena as Significant Weather (SIGWX) forecasts.
Class diagrams in this package are the controlled source of the meteorological objects which will also be used to generate Schematron rules for validation of those weakly-typed properties.

Cloud distribution.
See WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 FM 94 BUFR code table 0 20 008 "Cloud Distribution for Aviation".
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={744FB942-68DC-46a7-BE3A-4269AF963CA5}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=codeList;GUID={D85E0689-D54A-4ff3-B7BF-EA89A216C543};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::codeList;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={08FB315D-02E1-4b26-AC9E-6E9EEAD4BC5F}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation turbulence is represented by an area with information on its base, top and severity.
The turbulence object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated iwxxm:phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a iwxxm:ElevatedVolume with gml:Surface on CRS EPSG:4326 described by gml:CubicSpline with the boundary points of the area and base and top as the iwxxm:lowerElevation and iwxxm:upperElevation of the volume. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall describe the severity of the turbulence within the volume. See WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 FM 94 BUFR code table 0 11 030 "Extended Degree of Turbulence" for details.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={1458E900-99A1-432d-8790-EDB43B9FD947}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={0C820A71-EB8F-4d41-B2FA-B8AE56E0CC29}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation a jet is made up of a series of core points, wind symbols (fleche marks) and change bars. The wind symbol at the location of maximum jet speed/speeds also contain vertical depth information including the flight levels of the 80kt isotach below and above the maximum wind speed level. Only jet streams with a speed of 120 knots or more will contain vertical jet depth information.
The JetStream object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated iwxxm:phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Curve on CRS EPSG:4326 described by gml:CubicSpline with the core points. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall be a iwxxm:WAFCJetStreamWindSymbol describing the location of the wind symbol in latitude, longitude and elevation and other information when available. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall be repeated for all wind symbols.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={A4F5F8D5-F189-4781-B998-624CF64EEE0F}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={229B1BA3-CDC9-4149-9504-76BB395F87FC}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation tropical cyclone is described by its name, its intensity, its location and direction of movement.
The tropical cyclone object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Point on CRS EPSG:4326. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall indicate with iwxxm:WAFCTropicalCyclone the name, intensity and direction of movement of the tropical cyclone.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={5DF6D96C-0734-4c7c-9F29-0AD5AB4B1AD2}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={22B8D778-03B5-42cb-A25E-94883DADE9DE}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation radiation is represented by a point with information on the the name of the location and incident time.
The radiation object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Point on CRS EPSG:4326. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall describe with iwxxm:WAFCEvent the name of the location and incident time of the event.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={298C7526-703D-4b90-BCCC-4907C5334E16}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={5B4E48D3-2810-4b0e-BC4B-3F33B8E6D662}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation sandstorm is represented by a point with information on the the name of the location and incident time.
The sandstorm object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Point on CRS EPSG:4326. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall describe with iwxxm:WAFCEvent the name of the location and incident time of the event.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={44A6354B-4D2B-4bf2-97E6-4D62D910B7AF}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={8D5BB47E-3E8F-4b26-91C4-9FD0BD539A35}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation cloud is represented by an area with information on its base, top, type and distribution.
The cloud object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a iwxxm:ElevatedVolume with gml:Surface on CRS EPSG:4326 described by gml:CubicSpline with the boundary points of the area and base and top as the iwxxm:lowerElevation and iwxxm:upperElevation of the volume. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall describe type and distribution of cloud within the volume. See WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 FM 94 BUFR code tables 0 20 008 "Cloud Distribution for Aviation" and 0 20 012 "Cloud Type" for details.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={2E6EB4F2-632D-46c4-9BD1-28C9C9AEB7F5}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={DAC86B72-395D-42d7-A033-5C9F84C010FA}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation volcano is represented by a point with information on the the name of the location and incident time.
The volcano object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Point on CRS EPSG:4326. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall be a metce:Volcano.
WAFS Significant Weather Forecast

$XREFPROP=$XID={0401AA48-4871-4f32-8503-72D628BB9DAC}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=IWXXMXML;GUID={77ABC1C8-F960-4f97-8680-E0EEF7469612};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::IWXXMXML;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={DEF18B89-33B5-4d5d-9E60-06CC7E72957D}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

In the WAFC significant weather representation tropopause is made up of contours of tropopause elevation.
The tropopause object which is an instance of iwxxm:MeteorologicalFeature has the following characteristics at the indicated phenomenonTime:
1. iwxxm:phenomenonGeometry shall be a gml:Polygon on CRS EPSG:4326 described by gml:CubicSpline with points on the contour. 2. iwxxm:phenomenonProperty shall indicate the elevation of the contour with iwxxm:ElevatedLevel.

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast.WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast-3 Description: iwxxm:originatingCentre must have a child element of iwxxm:WorldAreaForecastCentre Assertion: ( exists(iwxxm:originatingCentre/iwxxm:WorldAreaForecastCentre) )
Pattern ID: WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast.WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast-2 Description: iwxxm:phenomenonBaseTime is mandatory Assertion: ( exists(iwxxm:phenomenonBaseTime) )

Pattern ID: WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast.WAFSSignificantWeatherForecast-1 Description: iwxxm:phenomenonCategory shall be equal to 'weatherForecasts'. Assertion: ( iwxxm:phenomenonCategory = 'weatherForecasts' )
Source -> Destination

This package provides basic features for describing meteorological and related phenomena specialised for the aviation domain.
Feature types defined in this package, in addition to the strong-typed approach usually employed in GML encoding pattern, also apply virtual-typed pattern in those areas where it is more convenient to define properties from a controlled source.
For ease of maintenance the controlled source are a set of constraints defined together with the Class diagrams used to generate the XML/GML application schemas of IWXXM. Scripts will be used to extract constraints from the Class diagrams and generate Schematron rules to enforce conformance to the information model.
Describes a 3 dimensional volume in terms of a horizontal area and an elevation, the latter of which can be expressed in metrics commonly used in the aviation domain.
Meteorological Feature

The time instant or period during which the indicated meteorological phenomenon occurred or is expected to occur.
When iwxxm:phenomenonCategory="weatherObservations" it is the observation time of the phenomenon.
When iwxxm:phenomenonCategory="weatherForecasts" it is the forecast time of the phenomenon.

Common constructs used across multiple packages. This package includes constructs closely related to the aviation weather domain.
References to WMO and ICAO Technical Regulations within this XML schema shall have no formal status and are for information purposes only. Where there are differences between the Technical Regulations and the schema, the Technical Regulations shall take precedence. Technical Regulations may impose requirements that are not described in this schema.

AerodromeForecastWeather enables the forecast weather at an aerodrome to be reported.
Only a specific set of weather phenomenon are reported within aviation meteorology as defined in Regulation ICAO Annex 3 / WMO No. 49-2.
This CodeList is specifically defined for aviation purposes as defined in WMO No. 49-2. A superset of definitions are defined in WMO No. 306 Vol I.1 code-table 4678 "Significant weather phenomena".

$XREFPROP=$XID={2AC765F7-8B7A-42a7-927A-557F7B9231CB}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=codeList;GUID={98671F90-3766-483f-AF10-CCAEFF4AC31E};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::codeList;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={14CFE2EE-7E14-4003-9798-5342B4376B6D}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

  • Thunderstorm with snow

Genus of cloud of operational significance to aviation: significant convective clouds only.
- Cumulonimbus - Towering cumulus
This CodeList is specifically defined for aviation purposes, as defined in WMO No. 49-2. A superset of definitions are defined in WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 FM 94 BUFR code-table 0 20 012 "Cloud type".

RelationalOperator defines the restricted set of operators that may be specified alongside numerical quantities in ICAO Annex 3/WMO No. 49.
These operators are used in cases where a precise value is not measurable, not precisely known due to measurement limitations, or not reported due to reporting restrictions.
For example, the "above" operator in conjunction with the reported quantity 10.6 indicates that the actual physical quantity is above 10.6 (at least 10.6).

Amount of cloud - assessed by category:
- Sky clear (0 oktas) - Few (1 - 2 oktas) - Scattered (3 - 4 oktas) - Broken (5 - 7 oktas) - Overcast (8 oktas)
This CodeList is specifically defined for aviation purposes, as defined in WMO No. 49-2. A superset of cloud-amount categories are defined in WMO No. 306 Vol I.2 FM 94 BUFR code-table 0 20 008 "Cloud distribution for aviation".

Pattern ID: Common.CloudLayer-1 Description: base shall be reported in metres (m) or feet ([ft_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:base) and not(iwxxm:base/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:base/@uom = 'm') or (iwxxm:base/@uom = '[ft_i]') ) else( true() ) )

The full, original TAC that could not be translated. When translation fails only the report type (i.e, SIGMET or METAR), translation information and other basic report metadata should be provided. In this case no translated content will be included other than the original TAC. Translation is considered to have failed when either not all of the TAC could be understood by the translation software or not all of the mandatory TAC content could be found. Permissible usage may be set as normal and TAC that failed translation may still be used for operational purposes, but under no circumstances should partially translated content be distributed or marked as operational
Not Specified

UML:Constraint.name: Extended content must not exceed 5000 characters

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: Common.Report-2 Description: Total size of extension content must not exceed 5000 characters per report Assertion: ( if( exists(.//iwxxm:extension) ) then( sum(.//iwxxm:extension/.//text()/string-length(.) ) +sum(.//iwxxm:extension/.//element()/( (string-length( name() ) * 2 ) + 5 ) ) +sum(.//iwxxm:extension/.//@*/( 1 + string-length(name()) + 3 + string-length(.) ) ) +sum(.//iwxxm:extension/.//comment()/( string-length( . ) + 7 )) lt 5000 ) else( true() ) )

UML:Constraint.name: Translated reports must include relevant attributes if translation failed

UML:TaggedValue.value: Pattern ID: Common.Report-1 Description: Translated reports must include @translatedBulletinID, @translatedBulletinReceptionTime, @translationCentreDesignator, @translationCentreName, @translationTime and optionally @translationFailedTAC if translation failed Assertion: ( if( exists(@translatedBulletinID) or exists(@translatedBulletinReceptionTime) or exists(@translationCentreDesignator) or exists(@translationCentreName) or exists(@translationTime) or exists(@translationFailedTAC)) then( exists(@translatedBulletinID) and exists(@translatedBulletinReceptionTime) and exists(@translationCentreDesignator) and exists(@translationCentreName) and exists(@translationTime) ) else( true() ) )
Source -> Destination
The base type for all reports, including information that is common across all report types.

Pattern ID: Common.BasicReport-3 Description: All gml:ids in IWXXM reports must be prefixed with 'uuid.' and must be UUID version 4 Assertion: ( if( //@gml:id[not(matches(.,'uuid\.[a-z0-9]{8}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{12}'))] ) then( false() ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.BasicReport-1 Description: Non-operational reports must include a permissibleUsageReason Assertion: ( if( @permissibleUsage = 'NON-OPERATIONAL' ) then( exists(@permissibleUsageReason) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.BasicReport-2 Description: Operational reports should not include a permissibleUsageReason Assertion: ( if( @permissibleUsage ='OPERATIONAL') then( empty(@permissibleUsageReason) ) else( true() ) )

Forecast cloud conditions, including predicted vertical visibility and cloud layers.
A single vertical visibility may be reported, but cannot be reported with cloud layers.

The vertical visibility. Vertical visibility is defined as the vertical visual range into an obscuring medium.
Vertical visibility shall be reported either in meters ("m") or feet ("[ft_i]").
Not Specified

$XREFPROP=$XID={C0A6275D-44E6-4486-9BD8-C25E4ED5994A}$XID;$NAM=CustomProperties$NAM;$TYP=attribute property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@PROP=@NAME=isID@ENDNAME;@TYPE=Boolean@ENDTYPE;@VALU=0@ENDVALU;@PRMT=@ENDPRMT;@ENDPROP;$DES;$CLT={B4B86911-F9AC-4403-834A-79821F446C2B}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeCloudForecast-2 Description: If cloud layers are reported vertical visibility should be empty Assertion: (if( exists(iwxxm:layer) ) then( empty(iwxxm:verticalVisibility) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeCloudForecast-1 Description: If vertical visibility is reported cloud layers should be empty Assertion: (if( exists(iwxxm:verticalVisibility) ) then( empty(iwxxm:layer) ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeCloudForecast-3 Description: verticalVisibility shall be reported in metres (m) or feet ([ft_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:verticalVisibility) and not(iwxxm:verticalVisibility/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:verticalVisibility/@uom = 'm') or (iwxxm:verticalVisibility/@uom = '[ft_i]') ) else( true() ) )

A nillable string quantity. References to this type may be nil and may include a nilReason
Source -> Destination

A forecast of wind conditions at an aerodrome.
Wind direction shall be given in degrees from true North. Plane angle unit of measure (uom) is "deg". A true north wind is indicated with a direction of 360. Calm wind is indicated with a direction of 0. Wind speeds and gusts, if present, shall be provided in either two units of measures: "m/s" or "[kn_i]" (knot).
This extends AerodromeSurfaceWindTrendForecast to allow for a variable wind direction to be reported. This class differs from a aerodrome wind observation in that the observations may include a min/max directional variability. This class only carries a true/false indication that it will be variable.
Indicates variable wind direction. Cannot be reported with a mean wind direction
Not Specified

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeSurfaceWindForecast-1 Description: Wind direction is not reported when variable winds are indicated Assertion: ( if( @variableDirection = 'true' ) then( empty(iwxxm:meanWindDirection) ) else( true() ) )
Source -> Destination

Examples of significant convective clouds (as defined for aviation purposes):
  • Cumulonimbus
  • Towering cumulus
A trend forecast of surface wind conditions at an aerodrome.

$XREFPROP=$XID={0902E2D1-6084-469f-B745-AEF80A4CC8AA}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=dataType;GUID={8AABD24A-2155-4fb9-B7C9-0398CC57F83F};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::dataType;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={EACDF6E8-B1FC-4f52-9198-7EA987EC963B}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

The forecast average wind direction from which wind is blowing.
Wind direction shall be given in degrees from true North. Plane angle unit of measure (uom) is "deg". A true north wind is indicated with a direction of 360. Calm wind is indicated with a direction of 0.
Not Specified

The forecast average wind speed.
Wind speeds shall be provided in either two units of measures: "m/s" or "[kn_i]" (knot).
Not Specified
http://codes.wmo.int/common/quantity-kind/windSpeed

Indication that the mean wind speed is above or below the reported value. To report a wind speed of at least 49 meters per second, wind speed is reported as 49 meters per second and the operator is reported as "above".
When no operator is reported, wind speed is an exact value with identical semantics to other measured quantities.
Not Specified

Forecast variations from the mean wind speed (gusts).
Wind gusts shall be provided in either two units of measures: "m/s" or "[kn_i]" (knot).
Not Specified

Indication that the wind gust speed is above or below the reported value. To report a wind gust speed of at least 49 meters per second, wind gust speed is reported as 49 meters per second and the operator is reported as "above".
When no operator is reported, wind gust speed is an exact value with identical semantics to other measured quantities.
Not Specified

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeSurfaceWindTrendForecast-1 Description: meanWindDirection shall be reported in degrees (deg) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:meanWindDirection) and not(iwxxm:meanWindDirection/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( iwxxm:meanWindDirection/@uom = 'deg' ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeSurfaceWindTrendForecast-2 Description: meanWindSpeed shall be reported in metres per second (m/s) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:meanWindSpeed) and not(iwxxm:meanWindSpeed/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:meanWindSpeed/@uom = 'm/s') or (iwxxm:meanWindSpeed/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )

Pattern ID: Common.AerodromeSurfaceWindTrendForecast-3 Description: windGustSpeed shall be reported in metres per second (m/s) or knots ([kn_i]) Assertion: ( if( exists(iwxxm:windGustSpeed) and not(iwxxm:windGustSpeed/@xsi:nil = 'true') ) then( (iwxxm:windGustSpeed/@uom = 'm/s') or (iwxxm:windGustSpeed/@uom = '[kn_i]') ) else( true() ) )
PermissibleUsageReason defines the restricted set of reasons for non-operational data

$XREFPROP=$XID={8C47021F-3D51-42d9-86CE-EE9777910B18}$XID;$NAM=Stereotypes$NAM;$TYP=element property$TYP;$VIS=Public$VIS;$PAR=0$PAR;$DES=@STEREO;Name=enumeration;GUID={AD881009-405F-4e8d-9E28-D17F8D05992D};FQName=UML Profile for IWXXM::enumeration;@ENDSTEREO;$DES;$CLT={F7CF6360-60C6-4eb6-A0E9-AAA998DDDF5C}$CLT;$SUP=<none>$SUP;$ENDXREF;

Data is part of a test activity and should not be used for operational purposes. This may include circumstances such as issuing a single message to assess a new data network path, or as part of a more organized test of message distribution/availability such as a regional SIGMET test
Not Specified

Data is part of a test exercise and should not be used for operational purposes. This may include circumstances where realistic data is issued to be used in organized exercises where users will practice or train for potential scenarios. For example, VA SIGMET exercises may include realistic data which is intended to be considered by users participating in the exercise but is not intended for operational use
Not Specified

Examples of cloud amount category:
  • few
  • scattered
  • broken
  • overcast

none#NOTES#Values: none,narrower,open,any Default: none Description: This refers to extensions by a third party, not to extensions by the owner of the vocabulary; the owner will always be able to revise the vocabulary. I.e., if the value is 'none', the referenced vocabulary may not be extended by third parties; if the value is 'narrower', the vocabulary may be extended by narrower terms that have an existing term as a parent; if the value is 'any', the vocabulary may be extended by additional terms on any level. This value must be 'all', empty or missing, if the value 'vocabulary' is empty or missing; in this case any vocabulary may be used.

http://codes.wmo.int/49-2/AerodromeRecentWeather#NOTES#Description: URI of the vocabulary/code list in the WMO Codes Registry or in some external registry. The value has to be provided, if an online version of the vocabulary is used.

none#NOTES#Values: none | narrower | open | any Default: none Description: This refers to extensions by a third party, not to extensions by the owner of the vocabulary; the owner will always be able to revise the vocabulary. I.e., if the value is 'none', the referenced vocabulary may not be extended by third parties; if the value is 'narrower', the vocabulary may be extended by narrower terms that have an existing term as a parent; if the value is 'any', the vocabulary may be extended by additional terms on any level. This value must be 'all', empty or missing, if the value 'vocabulary' is empty or missing; in this case any vocabulary may be used.

true#NOTES#Values: true,false Default: true Description: Encode code list as externally managed dictionary (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

none#NOTES#Values: none,narrower,open,any Default: none Description: This refers to extensions by a third party, not to extensions by the owner of the vocabulary; the owner will always be able to revise the vocabulary. I.e., if the value is 'none', the referenced vocabulary may not be extended by third parties; if the value is 'narrower', the vocabulary may be extended by narrower terms that have an existing term as a parent; if the value is 'any', the vocabulary may be extended by additional terms on any level. This value must be 'all', empty or missing, if the value 'vocabulary' is empty or missing; in this case any vocabulary may be used.

http://codes.wmo.int/49-2/SpaceWxLocation#NOTES#Description: URI of the vocabulary/code list in the WMO Codes Registry or in some external registry. The value has to be provided, if an online version of the vocabulary is used.

true#NOTES#Values: true,false Default: true Description: Encode code list as externally managed dictionary (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

none#NOTES#Values: none,narrower,open,any Default: none Description: This refers to extensions by a third party, not to extensions by the owner of the vocabulary; the owner will always be able to revise the vocabulary. I.e., if the value is 'none', the referenced vocabulary may not be extended by third parties; if the value is 'narrower', the vocabulary may be extended by narrower terms that have an existing term as a parent; if the value is 'any', the vocabulary may be extended by additional terms on any level. This value must be 'all', empty or missing, if the value 'vocabulary' is empty or missing; in this case any vocabulary may be used.

http://codes.wmo.int/49-2/AerodromePresentOrForecastWeather#NOTES#Description: URI of the vocabulary/code list in the WMO Codes Registry or in some external registry. The value has to be provided, if an online version of the vocabulary is used.
